title: Customized Language Education Strategies for Adult Learners to Enhance Metadata Expertise

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational metadata concept comprehension and information organization experience, familiarity with basic terminology in specialized fields (medical/legal/technical), technical documentation writing and reading skills
context.additional_context: Targets professionals in healthcare/legal/technical fields needing to strengthen practical competencies in response to metadata standard changes. Aims to effectively manage complex text structures and specialized terminology in their disciplines and achieve clear communication in interdisciplinary collaboration environments.

learning_goals: Analyze metadata standard changes and propose at least three practical educational strategies (e.g., improved terminology system, standardized document structure, multilingual metadata management).

Learners will reflect the five core principles of Andragogy (self-directedness, experience-based learning, etc.) to develop a 6-month self-directed learning plan, achieve ≥80% execution rate monthly, and document ≥3 reflective entries in a learning journal. Specifically, they will develop learning materials incorporating professional terminology and text structures from specialized fields (medical/legal/technical).

Complete a real-world work environment simulation project using PBL and develop ≥5 evaluation criteria (e.g., metadata accuracy, terminology consistency, document readability, search efficiency, interdisciplinary applicability).
Build a team-based metadata management system to improve collaboration efficiency by ≥20% (e.g., shared standardized glossary, cross-check protocols, feedback routines).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
